Definition: A class capturing a record of system user actions within an auditee's system, which includes instances of entry, approval, last modification, and posting of data or transactions.

Occurs at a specific date and time when a system user confirms the status of a data entry, indicating that it has been reviewed, validated, and authorized for further processing or inclusion in the financial records.

The initial action where a system user inputs new data into the accounting system at a specific date and time, generating a record representing a financial transaction or relevant account information. It involves the validation, approval, and official recording of the data entry, affirming its accuracy and completeness.

Refers to the most recent action taken to alter or update a data entry within the accounting system. It indicates the date and time of the last modification made to the entry, reflecting the latest revision or adjustment.
Involves the validation, approval, and official recording of a data entry within the accounting system by a system user at a specific date and time, affirming its accuracy and completeness.
A class that records specific actions or tasks completed or in progress.
The date marks when an activity occurred, ideally recorded automatically by the system.
The specified time at which an activity occurs.
A class containing information on system users, essential for managing access, security, and auditing system interactions.
A class that specifies the location details of an individual or entity.
The primary line of the street address.
The secondary line of the street address, if applicable.
The municipal designation within an address.
The code for the state or province of the address as specified by ISO 3166-2.
The code that identifies a specific geographic delivery area for an address.
The official code representing the country of an address, as standardized by ISO 3166-1.
A class that specifies a value of money in a given currency.
The numerical value representing a sum of money.
A class holds information about different currencies.

A class that keeps track of money values in different currencies, including the main, report, local, and transaction currencies for clear financial understanding and analysis in various regions and economies.
The monetary amount recorded in the functional currency. Primarily used for accounting purposes.
The monetary amount expressed in the currency of the country where the transaction took place.
The amount used in financial reporting, recorded in the reporting currency.
The monetary amount documented in business transaction records.

A class that includes the cumulative total and balance of all accounts within an accounting period. The multi-currency monetary amounts represents the total amount credited to an account during a specific accounting period. It reflects the cumulative sum of credit transactions recorded within the General Ledger, providing insight into the financial activity and changes within the specified period.

The multi-currency monetary amounts represents the total amount debited to an account during a specific accounting period. It reflects the cumulative sum of debit transactions recorded within the General Ledger, providing insight into the financial activity and changes within the specified period.
The multi-currency monetary amounts represents the monetary values of ledger accounts at the end of a specified accounting period
The initial amount of items in the inventory or the Property, Plant, and Equipment (PPE) account at the start of a period.

Denotes the quantity of inventory or Property, Plant, and Equipment (PPE) credited during a specific accounting period. It represents the cumulative total of quantities associated with credit transactions recorded within the General Ledger, offering insights into the inventory or PPE movements over the specified period.

Denotes the quantity of inventory or Property, Plant, and Equipment (PPE) debited during a specific accounting period. It represents the cumulative total of quantities associated with debit transactions recorded within the General Ledger, offering insights into the inventory or PPE movements over the specified period.
The final amount of items in the inventory or the Property, Plant, and Equipment (PPE) account at the end of a period.

The inventory product line item on a sales invoice.

A class capturing the details of sales orders, which form the basis for the three-way matching process by providing a record to match against customer deliveries and invoicing for transaction validation.

A class presenting specific information for each item on a sales order, important in the three-way matching process to confirm that deliveries and invoice details correspond to the order specifications.
A class representing a formal request from a customer for the delivery of goods or services within a specified period.
The recorded agreement to sell specific products or services as confirmed by a seller.

A class presenting specific information for each item on a sales order, important in the three-way matching process to confirm that deliveries and invoice details correspond to the order specifications.
The business segment pertaining to the organization that processes sales orders.
A class that records broad customer information related to sales orders.
The employee responsible for the sales order as a salesperson.
A class representing the detailed specifications for goods or services requested in a sales order.
The individual entry on a sales order that specifies the product or service to be sold.
The business segment concerning the organisation that handles the dispatch of sales shipments.
A class providing an overview of sales agreements, documenting the commitment to sell products or services within a specific period.
A class detailing the terms of individual items within a sales contract, including product details and financial terms.
A class capturing the details of goods shipped to customers in fulfillment of sales orders within a specified period.
The unique identifier for a shipment.
The number for a specific sales shipment.
The date on which goods were shipped to the buyer.
The number for a specific shipment, such as a company reference or an official waybill number from a logistics company.
The specific process or service selected to convey goods from sender to receiver, applicable to both outbound and inbound logistics.
A shipping company is an entity engaged in the transportation of goods across various modes of transport, providing logistical and support services to ensure safe and timely delivery.
The indicator signifying that the transaction reflects a shipment adjustment rather than the original shipment.
Textual clarification provided when changes are made to a recorded shipment, specifying the cause and nature of the adjustment.
A class capturing a record of system user actions within an auditee's system, which includes instances of entry, approval, last modification, and posting of data or transactions.
The total monetary amount for shipping all items in a sales shipment, recorded in the transaction currency.
A class detailing the specifics of items shipped, verified in the three-way matching process against sales orders and invoices to ensure accuracy and completeness of the sales cycle.

A specific duration within a fiscal year, delineated by its beginning and ending dates. It serves as the timeframe during which business transactions and entries are accumulated and organized into financial statements and reports.
A class signifies the structural units depicted within an organizational chart. It serves to illustrate relationships with business partners and conveys various business contexts.
The business segment concerning the organization that handles the dispatch of completed sales shipments.
A class that records broad customer information pertaining to made shipments.

A class capturing the details of sales orders, which form the basis for the three-way matching process by providing a record to match against customer deliveries and invoicing for transaction validation.
A class detailing the specifics of each item shipped, including the quantity, unit price, and total amount related to the sale.
The unique identifier for a line within a shipment document.
The number for a particular line within a shipping document.
The monetary amount of a specific line item in a sales shipment, recorded in the transaction currency, representing the cost of shipping.
The unit price for shipping a specific item in a sales shipment, recorded in the transaction currency.
The quantity of items listed as shipped on a sales shipment line.
A class signifies the structural units depicted within an organizational chart. It serves to illustrate relationships with business partners and conveys various business contexts.
The inventory product detailed in a sales shipment made line item.

A class presenting specific information for each item on a sales order, important in the three-way matching process to confirm that deliveries and invoice details correspond to the order specifications.
A class describing various methodologies adopted by the business to settle transactions, which can range from cash payments to bank transfers.
The unique code describing how a transaction is settled.
The designation of the procedure used for financial settlement.
The flag indicating if a settlement method is currently valid for settling transactions.
A class containing essential information about suppliers.
The unique identifier for a supplier account.
The number for a supplier's account.
The legal or registered name of the supplier.
The shortened form of the supplier's name.
The tax identification number assigned to the supplier by tax authorities.
The classification of the supplier within an organization's segmentation system.
The date marking the change of a supplier's status to inactive due to factors such as credit limit exceedance, legal constraints, contract cessation, or insolvency.
The percentage of discount offered by a supplier when payment is made within the specified discount days.
The number of days from the invoice date that the customer is eligible for the discount if payment is made.
The standard time period in days before a customer's payment is considered overdue.
A class capturing a record of system user actions within an auditee's system, which includes instances of entry, approval, last modification, and posting of data or transactions.
The address where billing-related documents should be sent for a supplier, typically used for remitting payments and financial documentation.
The geographic location of a supplier's premises, comprising street, number, city, and postal code, corresponding to the supplier's actual physical site.
The maximum monetary amount of credit that a supplier is willing to extend to its customers.
The maximum monetary amount a supplier permits a customer to owe for a single transaction.
The principal point of contact for a supplier, typically accountable for managing correspondence and agreements with customers or clients.
The customer associated with or equivalent to a specific supplier in business transactions.
A class with comprehensive descriptions of supplier classifications based on defined criteria.
A class that shows the organized relationships among suppliers.
The supplier that is classified at a subordinate level within a supplier hierarchy.
The supplier that is classified at a superior level within a supplier hierarchy.
A class with comprehensive descriptions of supplier classifications based on defined criteria.
The unique identifier for the type of supplier.
The identifier that categorizes the type of supplier within an organizational system.
The designation for the category of supplier based on their attributes.
A class representing the hierarchical categorization of supplier types for organizational and strategic purposes.
The specific category of supplier that is classified at a subordinate level within a supplier hierarchy.
The specific category of supplier that is classified at a superior level within a supplier hierarchy.
A class maintaining records of tax implications and obligations, essential for legal compliance and financial planning.
The monetary amount of tax assessed based on local tax regulations, recorded in the local currency.
The total monetary amount of tax applied to a specific transaction, recorded in the transaction currency.
The ledger account that records credits related to tax transactions.
The ledger account that records debits related to tax transactions.
A class outlining detailed classifications of tax types that the business encounters, supporting accurate tax reporting and compliance.
A class that includes regulatory information for taxation, offering instructions for compliance with tax laws in various jurisdictions.
The unique code for a regulatory body or jurisdiction.
The code for the country in which the tax regulator operates, as per ISO 3166-1.
The specific area within a country that falls under the jurisdiction of a tax regulator.
The name of the entity responsible for tax regulation.
The jurisdictional level at which the regulator operates, such as federal, regional, or local.
The identifier for the reporting organization as assigned by the tax regulator.
The binary indicator of whether a regulatory code is currently active.
The class represents tax reporting entities within the auditee's organization.
A class signifies the structural units depicted within an organizational chart. It serves to illustrate relationships with business partners and conveys various business contexts.
The ledger account used for recording accrued taxes as per regulatory requirements.
The ledger account used for recording tax expenses as per regulatory requirements.
The ledger account used for recording taxes payable as per regulatory requirements.
A class outlining detailed classifications of tax types that the business encounters, supporting accurate tax reporting and compliance.
The unique code used to classify a tax type.
The official title assigned to a category of tax.
The details that define and categorize a specific tax type.
The narrative that clarifies the specific tax code and its application within the broader tax type.
The standard rate applied to a specific tax type and code.
The class represents the business unit associated with reporting activities within the auditee's organization.
The class that holds regulatory information related to taxation, providing instructions for compliance with tax laws across different jurisdictions.
A class with user details, important for overseeing access, maintaining security, and tracking system use.
The unique identifier for individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system.
The flag indicating the active status of a user within the system. An active status signifies that the user is authorized and able to access system functionalities.
The date on which the activation or termination status of the user was last modified.
The identifying label assigned to an individual within the system.
The designation of the individual's role within the system, indicating their position or responsibility.
A descriptive depiction of the functional role or primary responsibility of the individual within the system.
The department within a business segment that is associated with a particular user.
